q: interview and a conference call with analysts, with Eric Schmidt describing Google Inc. 's co-founders as his "best friends." "I believe Larry is ready" to be CEO, Eric Schmidt said during the call. It's time for him to have a shot at running this. Page hailed Eric Schmidt as a "tremendous leader" whose contributions exceeded all expectations. "There is really no one else in the universe that could have accomplished what Eric Schmidt has done," Page said.

. Always stay alive." Brian Finneran doesn't argue with Michael Vick 's own self-description of the quarterback's Falcons years. " Mike Jensen always worked hard on the football field," Brian Finneran said. But as a quarterback, you've got to know everything about that offense, about the line, where the running backs are supposed to be. No question he could have worked harder in the film study room. It's been said before. I think he did the first couple of years, then got a little lax. Simon Cowell writes I look upon it[ groveling] as a sign of desperation. So many times people come in and they come up with this terrible dialogue about how much they like me or Randy or Paula. It's demeaning, and there's no point to it. We're not looking for a nice person; we're looking for somebody who's confident and assured, but talented above all. Trust me-- most stars aren't nice. 2. Trade unions and politicians have already accused Sergio Marchionne of "blackmail" in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure. Fiat is a great multinational which is growing in the world but its heart remains Italian, Industry Minister Paolo Romani said Saturday, adding, "All arguments are now closed. Romanni had said Monday that he would be asking Sergio Marchionne "to commit to investing in our country and remain with head and heart" in Italy. And that may have worked for two-reelers and shorts back in the thirties, but it doesn't work now- obviously. Was there ever any fallout with David Letterman over his cameo appearance, where he says, Hey, kid, wan na buy a monkey? Yes. He wanted that line in there all through the movie. He wanted to be in the movie more. Wait- really? No. Is that a real question?

Bernie Sanders wasted no time using the Tucson shooting to financially benefit his 2012 reelection campaign. From his email: In terms of this savage shooting rampage, several points need to be made. First, this horrendous act of violence is not some kind of strange aberration for this area where, it appears, threats and acts of violence are part of the political climate. Nobody can honestly express surprise that such a tragedy finally occurred. Sen.
